dcsl_miabot_driver.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 
00003 ## @file
00004 # A node that subscribes to the cmd_vel topic with Twist messages. It converts the velocity and angular velocity in the message to wheel speed commands and sends them to the robot over a serial connection.
00005 
00006 ## @author Brendan Andrade
00007 
00008 import math, serial, sys
00009 
00010 import roslib; roslib.load_manifest('dcsl_miabot_driver')
00011 import rospy
00012 from geometry_msgs.msg import Twist
00013 
00014 
00015 ## The callback function for when a Twist message is published on the cmd_vel topic.
00016 #
00017 # This function pulls the commands from the Twist message, converts them into wheel speeds for the robot, and then writes the wheel speed command to the serial port.
00018 # @param cmd_vel is the message object received by the subscriber.
00019 def callback(cmd_vel):
00020     # Parameters
00021     diffConversionFactor = 0.1 # Distance between the wheels in meters
00022     motorScaleFactor = 1000 # Commands are received in the Twist message in meters and the robot accepts them in mm. This is the scale factor.
00023 
00024     # Receive commanded velocity and angular velocity from message
00025     targetTransVel = cmd_vel.linear.x
00026     targetRotVel = cmd_vel.angular.z
00027 
00028     # Difference in speed between the wheels as this is a differential drive robot
00029     rotTerm = (math.pi/180.0) * targetRotVel / diffConversionFactor
00030 
00031     # Motor speeds in mm/s
00032     leftVel = int((targetTransVel - rotTerm) * motorScaleFactor)
00033     rightVel = int((targetTransVel + rotTerm) * motorScaleFactor)
00034 
00035     # Create string for commanding wheel speed and write it to the serial port.
00036     motorCommand = '[=<' + str(leftVel) + '><' + str(rightVel) + '>]' + '\n'
00037     ser.write(motorCommand)
00038 
00039     
00040 ## Main function which is called when the node begins
00041 #
00042 # Initializes the node and the subscriber
00043 def main():
00044     rospy.init_node('dcsl_miabot',anonymous=True)
00045     rospy.Subscriber("cmd_vel", Twist, callback)
00046     rospy.spin()
00047 
00048 ## This function is triggered when the node shuts down.
00049 #
00050 # Turns off the motor and closes the serial port.
00051 def closePort():
00052     leftVel = 0
00053     rightVel = 0
00054     motorCommand = '[=<' + str(leftVel) + '><' + str(rightVel) + '>]' + '\n'
00055     ser.write(motorCommand)
00056     ser.close()
00057 
00058 if __name__ == "__main__":
00059     args = rospy.myargv(argv=sys.argv)
00060     ser = serial.Serial()
00061     port = args[1]
00062     rospy.loginfo("Connecting to serial port at %s", port)
00063     ser.port = port
00064     ser.baudrate = 19200
00065     ser.timeout = 600
00066     ser.bytesize = serial.EIGHTBITS
00067     ser.stopbits = serial.STOPBITS_ONE
00068     ser.parity = serial.PARITY_NONE
00069     ser.open()
00070     main()
00071     rospy.on_shutdown(closePort())
00072
